intro: Cyrtandra umbellata, commonly known as the Hawaiian umbellate lily, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink in color. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces an umbel of small flowers at the tip of its stems. It thrives in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and is often found along stream banks. Cyrtandra umbellata is an important component of Hawaii's unique flora and is considered a rare and endangered species.
